page.title: 07S.E.LUTON URBAN TRANSECT(1)
page.content:
In buildings and land use,S.E.Luton is typical of many large towns and cities in the U.K.It provides a good example of the concentric ring theory of town development.A journey through the area from north to south would show.... { { {1.TOWN CENTRE OR CENTRAL BUSINESS {DISTRICT.}This provides a full range of shops and other services. It also includes the Town Hall and the main line railway station.There are few buildings of note, the area being dominated by a large indoor shopping complex. The provision of multi_storey car parks, an inner relief road and the part pedestrianisation of some streets means traffic is much less of a problem than a few years ago.
For{2,3 and 4}see page 8
